channel.title: CVE Feed for PTC -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for PTC -- all products

item.title: CVE-2023-5908|2023-11-30T22:03:58.098Z -- ptc -- kepserverex
item.description: KEPServerEX is vulnerable to a buffer overflow which may allow an attacker to crash the product being accessed or leak information.

item.title: CVE-2023-5909|2023-11-30T22:05:59.595Z -- ptc -- kepserverex
item.description: KEPServerEX does not properly validate certificates from clients which may allow unauthenticated users to connect.

item.title: CVE-2023-0755|2023-02-23T21:23:19.210Z -- ptc -- thingworx%20edge%20c-sdk
item.description: The affected products are vulnerable to an improper validation of array index, which could allow an attacker to crash the server and remotely execute arbitrary code.

item.title: CVE-2023-0754|2023-02-23T21:27:09.964Z -- ptc -- thingworx%20edge%20c-sdk
item.description: The affected products are vulnerable to an integer overflow or wraparound, which could allow an attacker to crash the server and remotely execute arbitrary code.

item.title: CVE-2023-29444|2024-01-10T17:06:35.965Z -- ptc -- kepware%20kepserverex
item.description: An uncontrolled search path element vulnerability (DLL hijacking) has been discovered that could allow a locally authenticated adversary to escalate privileges to SYSTEM. Alternatively, they could host a trojanized version of the software and trick victims into downloading and installing their malicious version to gain initial access and code execution.

item.title: CVE-2023-29445|2024-01-10T20:17:12.837Z -- ptc -- kepware%20kepserverex
item.description: An uncontrolled search path element vulnerability (DLL hijacking) has been discovered that could allow a locally authenticated adversary to escalate privileges to SYSTEM.

item.title: CVE-2023-29446|2024-01-10T20:21:51.434Z -- ptc -- kepware%20kepserverex
item.description: An improper input validation vulnerability has been discovered that could allow an adversary to inject a UNC path via a malicious project file. This allows an adversary to capture NLTMv2 hashes and potentially crack them offline.

item.title: CVE-2023-29168|2023-06-07T21:42:46.886Z -- ptc -- vuforia%20studio
item.description: The local Vuforia web application does not support HTTPS, and federated credentials are passed via basic authentication.

item.title: CVE-2023-29447|2024-01-10T20:24:52.983Z -- ptc -- kepware%20kepserverex
item.description: An insufficiently protected credentials vulnerability in KEPServerEX could allow an adversary to capture user credentials as the web server uses basic authentication.

item.title: CVE-2023-29152|2023-06-07T21:46:20.797Z -- ptc -- vuforia%20studio
item.description: By changing the filename parameter in the request, an attacker could delete any file with the permissions of the Vuforia server account.

item.title: CVE-2023-29502|2023-06-07T21:50:29.836Z -- ptc -- vuforia%20studio
item.description: Before importing a project into Vuforia, a user could modify the “resourceDirectory” attribute in the appConfig.json file to be a different path.

item.title: CVE-2023-4296|2023-08-31T14:44:51.524Z -- ptc -- codebeamer
item.description: ​If an attacker tricks an admin user of PTC Codebeamer into clicking on a malicious link, it may allow the attacker to inject arbitrary code to be executed in the browser on the target device.

item.title: CVE-2023-27881|2023-06-07T21:48:50.037Z -- ptc -- vuforia%20studio
item.description: A user could use the “Upload Resource” functionality to upload files to any location on the disk.

item.title: CVE-2023-24476|2023-06-07T21:44:56.326Z -- ptc -- vuforia%20studio
item.description: An attacker with local access to the machine could record the traffic, which could allow them to resend requests without the server authenticating that the user or session are valid.

item.title: CVE-2023-31200|2023-06-07T21:52:29.300Z -- ptc -- vuforia%20studio
item.description: PTC Vuforia Studio does not require a token; this could allow an attacker with local access to perform a cross-site request forgery attack or a replay attack.

item.title: CVE-2023-3825|2023-07-31T22:53:56.568Z -- ptc -- kepserverex
item.description: PTC’s KEPServerEX Versions 6.0 to 6.14.263 are vulnerable to being made to read a recursively defined object that leads to uncontrolled resource consumption. KEPServerEX uses OPC UA, a protocol which defines various object types that can be nested to create complex arrays. It does not implement a check to see if such an object is recursively defined, so an attack could send a maliciously created message that the decoder would try to decode until the stack overflowed and the device crashed.

item.title: CVE-2024-3951|2024-06-04T17:33:21.406Z -- ptc -- codebeamer
item.description: PTC Codebeamer is vulnerable to a cross site scripting vulnerability that could allow an attacker to inject and execute malicious code.
